Question asked: should i complete projects too? for getting advance certificate?

Students who have completed all 6 theory courses of the Diploma in Data Science, with one or both projects pending, will be awarded the Advanced Certificate in Machine Learning and Data Science.

Question asked: Difference between Reattempt and Reapply Qualifier?
Reply given:
Reattempt Qualifier Exam: This is for learners who were eligible to take the qualifier exam but did not pass or were absent. They can retake the exam in the same term without repeating the assignments.

Reapply Qualifier Exam: This is for learners who were not eligible to take the qualifier exam in the first attempt. They have to reapply in the next semester, redo the assignments, and pay the full fees.

Question asked: What are the eligibility criteria for the Data Science course?
Reply given:
The Data Science course at IIT Madras has no specific eligibility criteria for admission. However, to register for the BSc Degree Level, learners must have cleared all 8 courses in the Foundation Level and all 12 courses + 4 projects in the Diploma Level.

For the BS Degree Level, learners must have earned 114 credits and completed the BSc Degree Level to enter the BS Degree Level.

There are no specific age or background restrictions for learners. The course is designed to be flexible, allowing learners to choose their pace of study every term.

Additionally, learners can attempt the Direct Admission to Diploma (DAD) qualifier exam, which has specific qualifying criteria and cut-off marks for different categories.

Direct Admission to Diploma (DAD) Qualifier Exam
The DAD qualifier exam has the following eligibility criteria:

GEN / OBC-CLRs: 40% (6000/- fees)
SC/ST (Software Testing)/PwD: 30% (3000/- fees)
SC/ST (Software Testing) AND PwD: 30% (1500/- fees)
OBC-NCL, EWS: 35% (6000/- fees)

Question asked: What is the year-wise fee structure?
Reply given:
Year-wise Fee Structure for IIT Madras BS Degree Program
The year-wise fee structure for the IIT Madras BS Degree program is as follows:

Foundation Level
8 credits: Rs. 8,000 (Rs. 1,000 per credit)
36 credits: Rs. 72,000 (Rs. 2,000 per credit)
Total fees to earn the Foundation degree: Rs. 80,000 (8 credits) + Rs. 72,000 (36 credits) = Rs. 152,000
Diploma Level
42 credits: Rs. 1,68,000 (Rs. 4,000 per credit)
Total fees to earn the Diploma degree: Rs. 1,68,000 (42 credits)
BS in Electronic Systems
56 credits: Rs. 3,36,000 (Rs. 6,000 per credit)
Total fees to earn the BS degree: Rs. 3,36,000 (56 credits) + Rs. 1,48,000 (remaining credits) = Rs. 5,84,000
Fee waivers are applicable for different student categories based on their family income. The fee waiver structure is as follows:

Fee Waiver Structure Based on Category and Family Income
Category	Family Income > 5 LPA	Family Income > 1 LPA and <= 5 LPA	Family Income <= 1 LPA
General	Full Fee	50% waiver	75% waiver
OBC	Full Fee	50% waiver	75% waiver
SC / ST (Software Testing)	50% waiver	50% waiver	75% waiver
PwD	50% waiver	50% waiver	75% waiver (with EWS / OBC-NCL + Family Income)
SC / ST (Software Testing) + PwD	75% waiver	75% waiver	75% waiver
For international students, fee waivers are not applicable.

Question asked: What is end term eligibility in python?
Reply given:
To be eligible to write the end term exam in the Python course, a student must meet the following conditions:
Attend at least one of the two quizzes in person at designated centres.
Have an average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weeks of weekly assignment scores of 40/100 or more.
Additionally, to get the final course grade, a student must:
Attend the end term exam.
Score a minimum of 35% in the OPE (overall) exam.
Get the question based on Python-DB connectivity correct.
If a student fails to meet any of these conditions, they will not be eligible to get the final course grade.

Question asked: should I pay the full fee for all the four years at once or how will be the fee collected
Reply given:
Fee Collection for IIT Madras BS Degree Program
The fee for the IIT Madras BS Degree program will not be paid at one stretch. The actual fees you will be paying in each semester will be in proportion to the number of courses you register for in the respective semester.
Payment Structure
You will not be paying the entire Program fee or Foundational Level fee at one stretch. The actual fees you will be paying will be in proportion to the number of courses you register for in every semester.
Example
If you register for 2 courses in a semester, you have to pay the course fees only for those 2 courses.
Breakdown of Course Fee
To see a detailed breakdown of the course fee over each semester, please refer to the Fee Structure section in the Academics page and select your goal.
Payment Mode
Fees can be paid only through online mode. Fees through DD will not be accepted. You can pay using any Credit Card, Netbanking (all Indian Banks), Wallet, UPI (Google Pay, BHIM, etc.).

Question asked: I have Taken Double Drop for JEE and have Enrolled in IIT Madras BS Data Science so what to fill in Highest Education Attained and in Current Details Section?
Reply given:
For the Highest Education Attained section:

Since you have taken a Double Drop for JEE, it implies that you have not appeared for the JEE exam. Therefore, you have not completed your Class 12 or equivalent education through a regular stream. However, you have enrolled in the IIT Madras BS Data Science program.

Considering this, you can fill in "Class 12 or equivalent" as your Highest Education Attained, as you have not completed it through a regular stream but have been admitted to the IIT Madras BS Data Science program.

For the Current Details section:

Since you have already enrolled in the IIT Madras BS Data Science program, you can fill in the details of your current enrollment, such as the program name, enrollment date, and any other relevant information.

However, it is essential to note that the exact details to be filled in the Current Details section may vary depending on the specific requirements of the application form. It is recommended to refer to the official application form or consult with the IIT Madras admissions team for accurate guidance.

Question asked: Can I take Python before completing Computational Thinking
Reply given: No, you cannot take Python before completing Computational Thinking. According to the course requirements, Intro to Python requires completion of the CT (Computational Thinking) course.

Question asked: can a working professional apply for direct entry diploma
Reply given:
According to the provided context, the Direct Entry into Diploma programme is primarily aimed at working professionals or learners who already possess the fundamentals taught in Year 1 of this programme to enter the Diploma level directly.

Students who have completed 2 years in any UG degree programme are permitted to apply to the diploma level through direct entry. Their second year marksheet or higher must be submitted as proof to qualify under this category.

Therefore, yes, a working professional can apply for direct entry into the diploma programme, provided they meet the eligibility criteria.

Question asked: How can students raise a complaint through the Grievance Cell?

Students can raise a complaint through the Grievance Cell by using the following methods:
Email: Students can send an email to students-grievance@study.iitm.ac.in with their complaint.
Complaints Box: Students can also submit their complaints in the Complaints Box.
Note: The Grievance Cell aims to provide the support needed to help individuals decide the best course of action, and to resolve the issues raised through formal complaint procedures.

Question asked: what about placement support
Reply given: IIT Madras provides placement opportunities for both BS and BSc Degree graduates. For BS Degree graduates, the demand for skilled individuals in Electronic Systems is high. IIT Madras will actively reach out to recruiters in the context of placement opportunities for the graduates of the BS Degree Program. For BSc Degree graduates, the demand for data analysts/scientists and full stack developers is very high. IIT Madras will also actively reach out to recruiters in the context of placement opportunities for the graduates of the Online BSc Degree Program. Additionally, IIT Madras plans to give soft skills training as part of the program to enable learners with the right job opportunities.

Question asked: What is the syllabus for DBMS course?
Reply given:
Syllabus for Database Management Systems Course (BSCS2001)
The Database Management Systems course (BSCS2001) is a Diploma Level Course offered at IIT Madras. The course is designed to provide a comprehensive introduction to databases, database management, and relevant topics like database security, integrity, concurrency, and data warehousing.
Course Structure and Assessments
The course consists of 12 weeks of coursework, with the following structure: * Weekly online assignments * 2 in-person invigilated quizzes * 1 in-person invigilated end-term exam
Weekly Topics
The course is divided into 12 weeks, with the following topics covered:
WEEK 1: Course Overview
WEEK 2: Relational Model and Basic SQL
WEEK 3: Intermediate and Advanced SQL
WEEK 4: Relational Query Languages and Database Design
WEEK 5: Functional Dependency and Normal Forms
WEEK 6: Functional Dependency and Normal Forms (cont.)
WEEK 7: Application Development
WEEK 8: Storage Management
WEEK 9: Indexing and Hashing
WEEK 10: Transactions
WEEK 11: Backup and Recovery
WEEK 12: Query Optimization and Conclusion
Prescribed Books
The suggested book for the course is: * "Database Management Systems" by Abraham Silberschatz, Henry F. Korth, and S. Sudarshan

Question asked: grading policy for python
Reply given:
Grading Policy for Intro to Python Programming
The grading formula for the Intro to Python Programming course is as follows: T = 0.1GAA1 + 0.1GAA2 + 0.1Qz1 + 0.4F + 0.25max(PE1, PE2) + 0.15min(PE1, PE2) â€” capped to 100
Pass Criteria
To pass the course, a student must meet the following criteria: * Average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weekly assessments (objective and programming) scores >= 40/100
Course Completion Requirements
To complete the course, a student must: * Attend the end term exam * Obtain a minimum score of 40/100 in one of the programming exams (OPPE1 or OPPE2)
Exam Schedule
The exam schedule for the course is as follows: * Quiz 1: July 13, 2025 * OPPE1: July 20, 2025 * End Term: August 31, 2025 * OPPE2: August 24, 2025

Question asked: Eligibility criteria to appear for the end-term exam.
Reply given:
Eligibility Criteria to Appear for the End-term Exam
To appear for the end-term exam in any of the courses, the following eligibility criteria must be met:
Common Criteria
- Average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weekly assignment scores must be greater than or equal to 40/100. - Attendance in one of the 2 quizzes is mandatory.
Course-specific Criteria
- For Foundation Level Courses (Statistics for Data Science 1 and Statistics for Data Science 2): - The above common criteria must be met. - For Diploma Level Courses (Programming Concepts using Java): - The above common criteria must be met. - The student must attend at least one of the 2 quizzes in the center. - For Degree Level Courses (Deep Learning and AI: Search Methods for Problem Solving): - The above common criteria must be met.
Additional Requirements
- For all courses, attending the end-term exam is a requirement for course completion. Note: The eligibility criteria may vary slightly for each course, but the common criteria mentioned above must be met for all courses.

Question asked: syllabus for python
Reply given:
Syllabus for Python Programming Course
The Python programming course, BSCS1002, is a 12-week foundational level course that covers the basics of Python programming. The course is divided into the following weeks:
Week 1: Introduction to Algorithms
* Introduction to algorithms
Week 2: Conditionals
* Conditionals
Week 3: Conditionals (Continued)
* Continued discussion on conditionals
Week 4: Iterations and Ranges
* Iterations and ranges
Week 5: Iterations and Ranges (Continued)
* Continued discussion on iterations and ranges
Week 6: Basic Collections in Python
* Basic collections in Python, including lists, tuples, and dictionaries
Week 7: Basic Collections in Python (Continued)
* Continued discussion on basic collections in Python
Week 8: Basic Collections in Python (Continued)
* Further discussion on basic collections in Python
Week 9: File Operations
* File operations in Python
Week 10: File Operations (Continued)
* Continued discussion on file operations in Python
Week 11: Module System in Python
* Module system in Python
Week 12: Basic Pandas and Numpy Processing of Data
* Basic Pandas and Numpy processing of data The course also covers the following topics: * Using basic programming concepts such as variables, expressions, loops, conditionals, and functions in Python * Creating, manipulating, and using more Python-specific features * Familiarizing with and using common Python libraries such as random, math, datetime, scipy, matplotlib, Pandas, etc. * Analyzing real-life activities and casting them as programming problems * Applying programming concepts to analyze and solve diverse problems * Writing readable code and debugging it * Building small applications using Python

Question asked: What are the eligibility criteria for the Data Science course?
Reply given:
Eligibility Criteria for the Data Science Course
The Data Science course at IIT Madras has no specific eligibility criteria for admission. However, learners of any background, including engineering, sciences, humanities, arts, medicine, law, etc., can attempt and join the program.

There is no limitation on the age of the learner or their geographical location. The program is designed to be flexible, with two entry and four exit points, allowing learners to choose their pace of study every term.

Learners can attempt the respective stages of the program and those who clear each stage will receive the certificate corresponding to that stage alone. The diplomas or degrees are obtained by the candidate only when the requisite number of credits are accrued by completing the courses prescribed and satisfying any other mandatory criteria.

For the BSc Degree Level, learners should have cleared all 8 courses in the Foundation Level and all 12 courses + 4 projects in the Diploma Level. For the BS Degree Level, learners should have earned 114 credits and completed the BSc Degree Level to enter the BS Degree Level.

There are no specific qualifying criteria for admission to the program, and a significantly large number of learners can enter. The program is based on a qualifying process, and learners can attempt the respective stages of the program.

Question asked: Tell me about BS online degree programme
Reply given:
BS Online Degree Programme
The BS online degree programme offered by IIT Madras is a flexible and accessible way for learners to acquire a degree in a field of their choice. The programme is designed to accommodate a large number of learners, with no geographical restrictions, and allows learners to study at their own pace.

Key Features
Flexibility: The programme offers flexibility in terms of pace and goals, allowing learners to exit with certificates, diplomas, or degrees.
No prior knowledge of coding required: The programme is structured to provide learners with sufficient proficiency in programming and data science as they progress through the levels.
Online delivery: The programme is delivered entirely online, with pre-recorded lessons and assignments available on the portal.
Interaction with instructors and support team: Learners will have the opportunity to interact with instructors and the support team through live sessions and discussion forums.
Technological requirements: Learners will need access to a good internet connection, a laptop or desktop device, and familiarity with Google tools.
Programme Structure
The programme is split into three levels, which must be completed in sequence:

Foundational Level (8 courses): This level provides a foundation in programming and data science.
Diploma Level (6 Programming courses + 6 Data Science courses): This level provides specialized knowledge in programming and data science.
Degree Level (11 courses): This level provides advanced knowledge in the field of study.
Duration and Credits
The full programme can take anywhere between 3 and 6 years to complete, with an average completion time of 4 to 5 years for part-time learners. The programme requires a total of 142 credits to complete.

Access to IIT Madras Campus Facilities
Learners enrolled in the programme will not have access to IIT Madras campus facilities due to limitations of campus facilities and students being spread out geographically.

Language of Instruction
All programme courses are taught in English, and learners are expected to have a minimum proficiency in English language to participate in the programme.

Question asked: what is the syllabus for DBMS course?
Reply given:
Syllabus for Database Management Systems Course (BSCS2001)
The Database Management Systems course (BSCS2001) is a Diploma Level Course offered at IIT Madras. The course is designed to provide a comprehensive introduction to databases, database management, and relevant topics like database security, integrity, concurrency, and data warehousing.
Course Structure and Assessments
The course consists of 12 weeks of coursework, with the following structure: * Weekly online assignments * 2 in-person invigilated quizzes * 1 in-person invigilated end-term exam
Weekly Topics
The course is divided into 12 weeks, with the following topics covered:
WEEK 1: Course Overview
WEEK 2: Relational Model and Basic SQL
WEEK 3: Intermediate and Advanced SQL
WEEK 4: Relational Query Languages and Database Design
WEEK 5: Functional Dependency and Normal Forms
WEEK 6: Functional Dependency and Normal Forms (cont.)
WEEK 7: Application Development
WEEK 8: Storage Management
WEEK 9: Indexing and Hashing
WEEK 10: Transactions
WEEK 11: Backup and Recovery
WEEK 12: Query Optimization and Conclusion
Prescribed Books
The suggested books for the course are: * Database Management Systems by Abraham Silberschatz, Henry F. Korth, and S. Sudarshan

Question asked: what are the subjects in foundation level.
Reply given:
Foundation Level Courses
The Foundation Level comprises the following courses:
Mathematics for Data Science I (4 credits, BSMA1001)
Statistics for Data Science I (4 credits, BSMA1002)
Computational Thinking (4 credits, BSCS1001)
English I (4 credits, BSHS1001)
Mathematics for Data Science II (4 credits, BSMA1003)
Statistics for Data Science II (4 credits, BSMA1004)
Programming in Python (4 credits, BSCS1002)
English II (4 credits, BSHS1002)
These courses are designed to provide a solid foundation in Mathematics, Statistics, Basics of Programming and Python, and English, and are a prerequisite for proceeding to the Diploma Level courses.

Question asked: i have discrepancies in my graded assignments scores
Reply given:
Discrepancies in Graded Assignments Scores
If you have discrepancies in your graded assignments scores, you should follow the academic policies and procedures of IIT Madras.
Academic Policies
According to the academic policies, students can discuss and learn from each other, but assignments are expected to be done individually based on their understanding. Taking help from LLMs (e.g. ChatGPT, Gemini) partially or completely is considered plagiarism.
Procedure for Resolving Discrepancies
To resolve discrepancies in graded assignments scores, you should: 1. Review your graded assignments scores carefully. 2. Check if there are any errors in the grading process. 3. If you find any errors, contact your instructor or the course coordinator to report the discrepancies. 4. Provide evidence to support your claim, such as screenshots of your graded assignments or communication with your instructor. 5. Follow the academic policies and procedures of IIT Madras to resolve the discrepancies.
Additional Resources
For more information on academic policies and procedures, you can refer to the IIT Madras website or consult with your instructor or the course coordinator.
Conclusion
If you have discrepancies in your graded assignments scores, you should follow the academic policies and procedures of IIT Madras to resolve the issue. Review your graded assignments scores carefully, check for errors in the grading process, and contact your instructor or the course coordinator to report the discrepancies.

Question asked: What are the courses offered in Diploma in Data Science?
Reply given:
Courses for Diploma in Data Science
The Diploma in Data Science program at IIT Madras consists of the following courses:
Core Courses
* Machine Learning Foundations (4 credits) * Business Data Management (4 credits) * Machine Learning Techniques (4 credits) * Machine Learning Practice (4 credits) * Business Analytics (4 credits) * Tools in Data Science (3 credits)
Project Courses
* Business Data Management - Project (2 credits) * Machine Learning Practice - Project (2 credits) Note: The courses are based on the information provided in the context.

Question asked: what is the total fee of this bs degree in data science program
Reply given:
Total Fee of BS Degree in Data Science Program
The total fee for the BS Degree in Data Science and Applications program is not explicitly mentioned in the provided context. However, we can calculate the total fee based on the given fee structure. The total fee for the BS Degree in Data Science and Applications program is the sum of the fees for the Foundation, Diploma, and BS levels.
Foundation Level
The fee for the Foundation level is Rs. 80,000 (for general category students).
Diploma Level
The fee for the Diploma level is Rs. 2,48,000 (for general category students).
BS Degree Level
The fee for the BS Degree level is Rs. 1,24,000 (for general category students).
Total Fee
The total fee for the BS Degree in Data Science and Applications program is the sum of the fees for the Foundation, Diploma, and BS levels. Total Fee = Rs. 80,000 (Foundation) + Rs. 2,48,000 (Diploma) + Rs. 1,24,000 (BS) = Rs. 3,72,000 Therefore, the total fee for the BS Degree in Data Science and Applications program is Rs. 3,72,000.

Question asked: Fee structure for Data Science program with fee waiver.
Reply given:
The fee structure for the Data Science program with fee waiver is as follows:
General Category
Family Income > 5 LPA: Full Fee
Family Income > 1 LPA and <= 5 LPA: 50% waiver
Family Income <= 1 LPA: 75% waiver
OBC Category
Family Income > 5 LPA: Full Fee
Family Income > 1 LPA and <= 5 LPA: 50% waiver
Family Income <= 1 LPA: 75% waiver
SC / ST (Software Testing) Category
Family Income > 5 LPA: 50% waiver
Family Income > 1 LPA and <= 5 LPA: 50% waiver
Family Income <= 1 LPA: 75% waiver
PwD Category
Family Income > 5 LPA: 50% waiver
Family Income > 1 LPA and <= 5 LPA: 50% waiver
Family Income <= 1 LPA: 75% waiver (with EWS / OBC-NCL + Family Income)
SC / ST (Software Testing) + PwD Category
Family Income > 5 LPA: 75% waiver
Family Income > 1 LPA and <= 5 LPA: 75% waiver
Family Income <= 1 LPA: 75% waiver
Note: The fee waiver structure is based on the family income of the candidate, and the required documents for availing fee waiver include the Family Income Certificate and EWS / OBC-NCL certificate, if applicable.

Question asked: What are the eligibility criteria for the Data Science course?
Reply given:
Eligibility Criteria for the Data Science Course
The Data Science course at IIT Madras has no specific eligibility criteria for admission. However, learners of any background, including engineering, sciences, humanities, arts, medicine, law, etc., can attempt and join the program.

There are no limitations on the age of the learner or their geographical location. The program is designed to be flexible, with two entry and four exit points, allowing learners to choose their pace of study every term.

Learners can attempt the respective stages of the program and those who clear each stage will receive the certificate corresponding to that stage alone. The diplomas or degrees are obtained by the candidate only when the requisite number of credits are accrued by completing the courses prescribed and satisfying any other mandatory criteria.

For the BSc Degree Level, learners should have cleared all 8 courses in the Foundation Level and all 12 courses + 4 projects in the Diploma Level. For the BS Degree Level, learners should have earned 114 credits and completed the BSc Degree Level to enter the BS Degree Level.

Question asked: Grading Policy for PDSA ?
Reply given:
Grading Policy for PDSA
The course is Programming Data Structures and Algorithms using Python (Diploma Level Courses).
Grading Formula:
The grading formula for PDSA is: T = 0.1GAA + 0.4F + 0.2OP + max(0.2max(Qz1, Qz2), (0.15Qz1+0.15Qz2))
Pass Criteria:
To pass the course, the student must meet the following criteria: * Average of the best 5 out of the first 7 weekly assessments (objective and programming) scores >= 40/100 * Attend at least one of the 2 quizzes in the centre

Question asked: Tell me about internship and full time support eligibility?
Reply given:
Internship and Full-time Support Eligibility
The IITM BS program has an active group working with IITM's on-campus internships and placement wing, approaching partner companies for relevant opportunities for students who graduate.
Internship Details
* A pool of qualified double diploma holders in programming and data science from IIT Madras will be available for companies to hire as interns for longer durations of 6 months or 1 year. * After completing 8 months of internship, a letter from the Reporting Manager should be submitted to the IITM BS program on the company's letterhead stating the work done by the student and whether it was satisfactory.
Eligibility and Credits
* Students can pursue a maximum of 2 courses each term during the duration of the apprenticeship. * Academic credits for apprenticeship: * Less than 4 months: 0 credits * Between 4-8 months: 4 credits * 8 months: 12 credits For more details, please refer to the Apprenticeship link and Internship & Placement brochure.
